title: Why the Duchess of Sussex’s South Africa tourdrobe was a royal fashion game changer
text:
Forget Downton Abbey and Paris Fashion Week, the costume drama gripping royal fashion watchers over the past ten days has been the Duchess of Sussex’s South Africa tourdrobe which has been extraordinary in its, well, ordinariness.

I have been writing about royal tour fashion for several years now, and no matter where they take place, there’s usually a gentle yet gripping rhythm to the kinds of looks we expect to see: there will be a handful of major moments usually involving jewels and couture to remind us of the royals’ otherworldly glamour, a few outfits will offer a diplomatic nod to the host country - either by incorporating colours and symbols or because they are made by a local designer...
description: Forget Downton Abbey and Paris Fashion Week, the costume drama gripping royal fashion watchers over the past ten days has been the Duchess of Sussex’s South Africa tourdrobe which has been extraordinary in its, well, ordinariness.
